communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Christ Family
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FBI records related to a religious cult named the Christ Family, active since the end of the 1960s and based in Hemet (California), and led during his lifetime by an individual named Charles Franklin McHugh, known among his followers as Lightning Amen

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jean-Marie Pottier

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Eugene Abrams Records (United States Postal Service, Office of Inspector General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please furnish all records as to Eugene Abrams (d.o.b. 01/10/1934, d.o.d. 07/17/2023).

Eugene Abrams ran a pornography ring out of his home at 1033 Littleneck Avenue, North Bellmore, NY 11710. Abrams later resided at 6400 Hayes St, Hollywood, FL 33024, 2459 N 37th Ave, Hollywood, FL 33024, and 9195 SE 197th Ave, Ocklawaha, FL 32179. Abrams also worked on several government projects concerning the moon-space project and the anti-ballistic missile early warning system.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lena Ajit

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Delaware Traffic Skims
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

"Traffic skim" model data between each Traffic Analysis Zone (TAZ). This should be a CSV file or Excel spreadsheet with the following columns (and perhaps forecasted data columns for future years)

• Origin zone number
• Destination zone number
• Real automobile distance for the modeled year (in miles)
• Real automobile time for the modeled year (in minutes)

I assume the zones align with this layer: https://enterprise.firstmap.delaware.gov/arcgis/rest/services/Transportation/DE_Boundary_and_Point/MapServer/20

Please provide this in the original machine readable format (CSV, XLSX, SQL, etc.)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware.

communications.subject: RE: FOIA #24-0334/Rudenberg/Traffic Skim Model Data
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Rudenberg,

The Delaware Department of Transportation (“DelDOT”) received your FOIA request, below. It was forwarded to me for research and response. Before I am able to proceed with your request, I will need more information. Can you explain to me what your definition of a “traffic skim” is so that I can understand what your request is and forward it to the appropriate sections.

Thank you,

Shanita Hall
Paralegal III
Legal Department
Department of Transportation
800 Bay Road
P.O. Box 778
Dover, DE 19903

title: Arkansas Department of Corrections Data Request

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas Department of Corrections Data Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-101 et seq., I request that the Arkansas Department of Corrections make the below documents available for copying or inspection. 

Please provide data sufficient to identify each person currently incarcerated in an Arkansas Division of Correction (“ADC”) facility based on a parole revocation. This includes any existing data compilation, including but not limited to any existing rosters of currently incarcerated people, that contains the following information: 

1) Name; 
2) ADC number; 
3) Admission date; 
4) Reason for admission; 
5) Current facility; and 
6) Projected release date. 

I ask that the Board provide the above records within three business days of receipt of this request, as required by Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-105(e). I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. I also ask that the Board provide me with a fee estimate prior to fulfilling any request. 

Should any part of the above request be denied, I request the Board provide a written response citing the specific statutory exemption, as required by Ark. Code. Ann. § 25-19-105(a)(3). If some of the above records are disclosable and others exempt, please provide the disclosable documents and provide the exemption(s) preventing disclosure of the rest per Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-105(f). If any of the above documents are administratively controlled by a different custodian than the Board, I ask that the Board please provide those custodians’ information, per Ark. Code. Ann. § 25-19-105(a)(3)(C).   

Please note that I am a citizen of Arkansas, and I am using MuckRock’s services to help manage and track my request. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Matthew.

communications.subject: RE: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas Department of Corrections Data Request
communications.communication:
Sonny Albarado,

The Arkansas Department of Corrections received your request below.  The information that you are seeking can be found on the Department's website via this link, https://apps.ark.org/inmate_info/index.php.
Via the link, you can select "Probation Revocation" as the Offense Category and it will show a list of inmates that includes the information that you requested below.


Thank you,
LATISHA MEADOWS
Quality Assurance Coordinator
Arkansas Department of Corrections
Phone: 1-501-537-7677
Email: Latisha.Meadows@doc.arkansas.gov<mailto:Latisha.Meadows@doc.arkansas.gov>

title: Israel Payment For Damage to USS Liberty During June 8, 1967 IDF Attack.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Israel Payment For Damage to USS Liberty During June 8, 1967 IDF Attack.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The USS Liberty was attacked by the Israel Defense Force on June 8, 1967. I am a survivor of that attack.

In 1980 the Israeli government agreed to pay $6,000,000 for the damage to the ship.

I am requesting all correspondence between the US and Israeli governments related to the payment for the damage to the USS Liberty.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FDLE State Exam Applicants
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Information on all applicants who took the FDLE State Exam / State Officer Certification Examination going back as far as possible to the present. 

Data elements for all applicants:
* Applicant's full name
* Date of exam
* Applicant's date of birth or, if not releasable, year of birth or age at time of exam
* Applicant's city and/or zip code of residence at time of exam
* Applicant's score on the exam
* Whether applicant passed the exam

Please include this information for an applicant for as many times as they took the exam. If your certification system contains data elements not listed above, please include them in the response, provided they are releasable under the law. On the other hand, I recognize some of the information I am asking for may not be tracked by your system. If that is the case, I am willing to accept as many of the data elements as your agency maintains. If some records are more readily available, I am happy to receive partial information as soon as possible while the remaining request is processed.

In addition to the data elements listed, I request documentation necessary to understand and interpret the data, including but not limited to record layouts, data dictionaries, code sheets, lookup tables, etc.

My preference is to receive structured data provided in a csv file. I can also handle a variety of other data formats including machine-readable text files, such as delimited or fixed-width formats, SQL databases, Excel workbooks and MS Access. If there are additional formats your agency would prefer to provide, please let me know.

Please send clarifications and questions via electronic communication at any time.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Aleksei Opacic

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Aleksei Opacic

communications.subject: FW: Public Records Request Confirmation Receipt, FDLE Docket No. PRR-2024-3441
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Opacic:

Thank you for contacting the Florida Department of Law Enforcement's Public Records Section. Your tracking number is PRR-2024-3441.

Public records requests are processed in the order that they are received. Processing time may be lengthy due to the nature and extent of the request. Searches may be negative and FDLE may not have records responsive to your public records request. You may also receive an invoice for your request depending on the nature and extent of your public records request. A copy of the FDLE Guide to Public Records is attached for your review.

Please be advised that FDLE may not be the custodian of all of the records you requested. FDLE is not the custodian of all State of Florida criminal incident-related records for every state and local criminal justice agency.

Additional information regarding how to obtain public records including what costs may be applicable may be found on our website http://www.fdle.state.fl.us/OGC/Public-Records.aspx.

We are committed to our fundamental values of Service, Integrity, Respect, and Quality.

If you have questions concerning your request, please contact us at (850) 410-7676 or publicrecords@fdle.state.fl.us<mailto:publicrecords@fdle.state.fl.us>, and please include your "PRR" docket number we've provided above.

Sincerely,

Office of Open Government - Public Records Section
Florida Department of Law Enforcement
Phone: 850-410-7694


CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE - The information contained in this e-mail transmission from the Florida Department of Law Enforcement is privileged and CONFIDENTIAL. It is intended for the sole use of the person (s) or entity named. If you are not the intended recipient of this transmission, the dissemination, distribution, copying, or other use of this information may constitute a violation of §119, F. S. and is strictly prohibited. If you have received this email in error, please contact the sender immediately.

title: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Prisoner Assembly Policies

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Prisoner Assembly Policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any and all policies, procedures, directives, regulations, or equivalent guiding materials regarding restrictions and rules of inmate congregating or inmate group assembling for all of the 42 prisons under the purview of the New York State Department of Corrections, including all security levels and male and female facilities. Please provide materials for as many facilities as available if not all facilities have relevant documents. If relevant documents apply to all New York State prisons and are not specific to the facility, please provide these guiding materials. Please provide all relevant materials for 2019 and 2020 for each available facility, or the closest available year if these years are not available.

2. Any and all policies, procedures, directives, regulations, or equivalent guiding materials regarding appropriate physical contact between inmates for all 42 prisons under the purview of the New York State Department of Corrections, including all security levels and male and female facilities. Please provide materials for as many facilities as available if not all facilities have relevant documents. If relevant documents apply to all New York State prisons and are not specific to the facility, please provide these guiding materials. Please provide relevant materials for 2019 and 2020 for each available facility, or the closest available year if these years are not available.

3. Counts of disciplinary infractions related to prohibited inmate congregating or group assembling of inmates for each of the 42 prisons under the purview of the New York State Department of Corrections, including all security levels and male and female facilities. Please provide counts for as many facilities as available if not all facilities have counts available. Please provide counts for 2019 and 2020 for each available facility, or the closest available year if these years are not available. 

4. A count of disciplinary infractions related to prohibited intimate or sexual contact for each of the 42 prisons under the purview of the New York State Department of Corrections, including all security levels and male and female facilities. Please provide counts for as many facilities as available if not all facilities have counts available. Please provide counts for 2019 and 2020 for each available facility, or the closest available year if these years are not available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lauren Hagani

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the period of 01/01/2022 until date of processing:

1. Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails, text messages, instant messages, and recorded phone or video calls or metadata) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) to or from the accounts for Sheriff Corpus and Chief of Staff/Assistant Sheriff Aenlle.

2. Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails, text messages, instant messages, and recorded phone or video calls or metadata) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) that mention "Corpus", "Aenlle", "Cordell", "Tapia", "Monaghan", "Hsiung" or their associated usernames on internal systems.

Please include all attachments with all messages.

In all cases, I expect there could be personnel- and case- related messages that cannot be disclosed. Please exclude those. I am only interested in any communications not tied to particular cases and not explicitly covered by exemptions regarding personnel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ewen Cheslack-Postava

title: Skydio/Axon communications and materials (San Mateo Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Skydio/Axon communications and materials (San Mateo Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

In a recent city council meeting (https://sanmateo.primegov.com/Portal/Meeting?meetingTemplateId=8018) Amendment No. 3 to the master services and purchasing agreement with Axon Enterprise, Inc. was approved for use of a Skydio X10 drone and associated Skydio Remote Flight Deck Software.

Therefore, I hereby request the following records, from Jan 01, 2024 to the processing of this request:

1) Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) that mention "Skydio", "X10", or "Remote Flight Deck". This includes communications from Skydio, Axon Enterprise, Inc., or any other external entities that may have been consulted. Please include all attachments.

2) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, and PowerPoint files), and other guidance on the features and use of Skydio drones. This can exclude notes taken during meetings, but should include A) any explanations (whether internally or externally generated) of how Skydio works, and B) any other document that has been used to help explain the use of Skydio, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

3) A copy of any materials related to evaluation of the addition of Skydio equipment (such as possible effects on privacy impact assessments, use policies, standard operating procedures, or data retention policies) not covered by (1) (such as meeting notes not captured in email).

I also request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, XLS, or PPT file), to avoid copying costs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ewen Cheslack-Postava

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I hope this request finds you in good spirits.
I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be provided to me that pertains to all prisons in Illinois:

All reports of incidents involving negative or positive results for testing of substances on incoming mail in the year 2024. 

I know that these documents exist because of the news report at  https://www.wsiltv.com/news/top-stories/multiple-incidents-reported-at-correctional-centers-in-illinois-recently/article_b743ad4c-713a-11ef-9c3b-734b1ee6bd83.html where documents are attached. The article states, "One report (attached below) was sent to News 3 from Senator Bryant. It stated an incident took place on August 16, 2024, at the Pinckneyville Correctional Center." The article also contains, "Another report Senator Bryant sent to News 3 was from Big Muddy River Correctional Center with the incident date of 7.11.24." 

In a later article, Senator Bryant claims she has 60 incident reports. I'm requesting all of these plus all the reports mentioned in the WSIL article:

Big Muddy River Correctional Center 7.11.24
Menard Correctional Center 8.27.24

title: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigation into Google practices

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigation into Google practices
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Final Agency Documents (July 1, 2023 to present):
a. Orders, notices, or formal communications sent to Google LLC regarding potential supervision under 12 U.S.C. § 5514(a)(1)(C)
b. Risk assessment determinations regarding Google's digital payment services
c. Final agency determinations regarding supervisory authority over digital payment services
Consumer Protection Records:
a. Aggregate data and statistical analyses of consumer complaints regarding Google Wallet and Google Pay (with personal information redacted)
b. Risk assessment frameworks used to evaluate digital payment services
c. Reports analyzing potential consumer harm in digital payment markets

Public Interest Information:
a. Records reflecting CFPB's legal analysis of supervision authority over non-bank entities under 12 U.S.C. § 5514
b. Communications with other federal regulators regarding supervision of digital payment services
c. Final agency policies or procedures for supervising digital payment providers

Already Public Information:
a. Records previously disclosed to Congress or other agencies regarding digital payment supervision
b. Public statements, testimony, or reports regarding CFPB's digital payment services oversight
c. Generic supervision procedures already published in CFPB's examination manual

++ Segregability and Format

Please segregate and release all non-exempt portions of records. For consumer complaint data, statistical aggregates and anonymized analyses are specifically requested rather than individual complaints. For supervision procedures, general frameworks rather than specific examination steps are sought.

++ Legal Basis for Release

Ongoing Enforcement Considerations:
- NLRB v. Robbins Tire & Rubber Co., 437 U.S. 214, 232 (1978): Exemption 7(A) requires specific demonstration of enforcement interference
- Citizens for Responsibility & Ethics in Washington v. DOJ, 746 F.3d 1082, 1098 (D.C. Cir. 2014): Agency must show concrete harm to ongoing enforcement 
- Mappv v. CFPB, No. 20-cv-3510 (D.D.C. 2022): CFPB required to segregate and release non-sensitive enforcement information

Commercial Information:
- Food Marketing Institute v. Argus Leader Media, 139 S. Ct. 2356 (2019): Only information customarily and actually kept private qualifies under Exemption 4
- Supervision frameworks and general procedures do not constitute protected commercial information
- Public statements by Director Chopra regarding supervision approach reduce commercial sensitivity

Deliberative Process:
- Coastal States Gas Corp. v. DOE, 617 F.2d 854, 866 (D.C. Cir. 1980): Final opinions and interpretations must be released
- CFPB's legal determinations about supervisory authority are final agency decisions
- Frameworks for evaluating risk are working law rather than deliberative materials

Financial Institution Reports:
- Consumers Union of United States, Inc. v. Heimann, 589 F.2d 531 (D.C. Cir. 1978): Exemption 8 protects specific examination findings, not general procedures
- Bloomberg L.P. v. SEC, 357 F. Supp. 2d 156 (D.D.C. 2004): Public interest balancing required even for exempt materials

++ Public Interest Justification

Release is warranted because:
- CFPB's novel application of supervisory authority to technology companies represents a significant policy development
- Digital payment services affect millions of consumers
- Director Chopra has publicly acknowledged the importance of transparency in tech supervision
- Supervision frameworks are necessary for public accountability
- Congressional oversight requires public understanding of CFPB's legal interpretations

++ Request for Expedited Processing

Expedited processing is warranted under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E) because:
- The matter concerns federal regulatory activity affecting millions of consumers
- Delay would compromise substantial due process rights
- The topic is under active public and Congressional scrutiny

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kyle Wiggers

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Massive Blue (Somerton Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports state that departments in you state have partnered with Massive Blue, an AI company (discussed at recent county council meeting). 

Therefore, I hereby request the following records:

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on the use of Massive Blue, "Overwatch," VIPS (Virtual Investigator Protection Service), RADAR: (Realtime active data aggregation reporter), and/or ITFM System (Investigative Task Force multiplier). This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discussed the use of Massive Blue/Overwatch, B) any explanations (whether internally or externally generated) of how Massive Blue/Overwatch works, and C) any other document that has been used to help explain the use of Massive Blue/Overwatch, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) A copy of any privacy impact assessments, use policies, technical explainers or assessments, standard operating procedures, data retention policies, legal opinions or assessments, warranties, non-disclosure agreements, contracts, liability waivers, insurance agreements, Requests for Proposals, Responses to Requests for Proposal, Memorandums of Understanding, Letters of Interest, usage policies, or informal agreements between the police department/this office and Massive Blue.
